meanings.definition: A person who drinks wine excessively.
meanings.sent1: The winesops at the party were loud and unsteady.
meanings.sent2: He became known as a winesops after drinking too much at the celebration.
meanings.sent3: The winesops tried to dance but kept bumping into furniture.
meanings.sent4: Her uncle, a winesops, always saw the world through a blurry lens.
meanings.sent5: The winesops stumbled out of the bar, leaving a trail of spilled wine behind.

meanings.sent1: She winesops every Friday night with her friends.
meanings.sent2: They warned him not to winesops before the important meeting.
meanings.sent3: The guests decided to winesops to celebrate the end of the harvest.
meanings.sent4: The river seemed to winesops into the horizon under the setting sun.
meanings.sent5: The group planned to winesops until the early hours of the morning.

meanings.sent2: She made a delicious pie using winesops from her own garden.
meanings.sent3: The winesops were so juicy that they dripped down his chin.
